profile_positions.description: Project Lead for the Order To Cash (OTC) and Forecast To Supply (FTS) workstreams for the SAP implementation of Stryker’s European Regional Headquarters (RHQ). This covers the processes Sales Order Management,  Planning, Warehouse & Distribution, Transportation Management and Global Trade (Compliance) Management.  A dedicated drop ship functionality where the RHQ buys from Stryker European manufacturers and sells to Stryker global distributors makes this complete. About 45% of Stryker’s global volume runs through this model. On the Warehouse & Distribution side SAP has been completely interfaced with a Goods to Man, fully automated storage and retrieval system (Knapp, OSR).     Additionally I have lead the different test cycles for the project, System Integration Testing (SIT) and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to a successful outcome.
profile_positions.title: Stryker Accelerate Release 3 (RHQ) Workstream Lead OTC + FTS - SAP deployment

profile_positions.description:
In this role directly responsible for Supply Chain Design and Optimization of Stryker EMEA Operations.
 
In 2017 I have been responsible for the integration into Venlo DC of global distribution of finished goods manufactured by Stryker plants in Limerick, Cork, Freiburg and Tijuana. The last one (in Mexico) after it had been acquired by Stryker at the end of 2016.

In 2016 I have been the workstream lead for the processes Sales Order Management, Warehouse & Distribution, Transportation Management and Global Trade (Compliance) Management for the project ‘Centrum Bridge’. Objective of this project was to move the supply of products from all OEM (3rd party) suppliers based in EMEA to a newly created Regional Headquarters (RHQ) Warehouse, part of the Venlo CDC. The Venlo CDC started to do the global distribution of these products.

In 2014 Stryker created the European Regional Headquarters (RHQ) and after taking part in the (Oracle) design, I took full responsibility for all system transactions (Supply Chain function) following successful testing and go-live.

In 2013 I led the integration into the Venlo DC of the EMEA Distributor’s (3rd party) business. Additional product labelling for countries like Turkey and Russia significantly increased the Value Added Service (VAS) activities  in Venlo. Stryker closed the warehouse in Switzerland.      

In 2012, after an acquisition from Boston Scientific, I was the project lead for the integration into the Venlo DC of the global distribution of Stryker’s Neurovascular products.

In 2010 following an internal Supply Chain Optimization study it was decided to change the European business model and Stryker’s first global Tier 1 CDC in Venlo was introduced. Being the Business Architect of the supporting European Oracle solution I ensured alignment with the role of the Central Distribution Center and the newly created Country Satellite Warehouses. Additionally one Legal Entity owns, plans and controls all inventories in the area.
